servers.name: Sentry
servers.description: Error monitoring, performance analysis, and application observability via Sentry
servers.setup_instructions:
1. Go to Sentry Settings > API Keys
2. Create a new API key with project:read and event:read scopes
3. Set SENTRY_API_KEY and SENTRY_ORG_SLUG in your .env file

servers.name: Linear
servers.description: Project management, issue tracking, sprint planning via Linear
servers.setup_instructions:
1. Go to Linear Settings > API
2. Create a new personal API key
3. Set LINEAR_API_KEY in your .env file

servers.name: Notion
servers.description: Documentation, knowledge bases, and structured information via Notion
servers.setup_instructions:
1. Go to Notion Settings > Integrations
2. Create a new internal integration
3. Set NOTION_API_KEY in your .env file
4. Share relevant pages with the integration

servers.name: Render
servers.description: Cloud infrastructure, deployments, and service management via Render
servers.setup_instructions:
1. Go to Render Account Settings > API Keys
2. Create a new API key
3. Set RENDER_API_KEY in your .env file

servers.name: Stripe
servers.description: Payment processing, subscriptions, billing, and revenue analytics via Stripe
servers.setup_instructions:
1. Go to Stripe Dashboard > Developers > API Keys
2. Copy your secret key (use test key for development)
3. Set STRIPE_API_KEY in your .env file

servers.name: Filesystem
servers.description: Local filesystem operations for reading and writing files
servers.setup_instructions: No setup required - filesystem access is built-in

servers.name: Web Search
servers.description: Web search using Perplexity API with AI-powered summarization
servers.setup_instructions:
1. Sign up at perplexity.ai
2. Go to API settings and create an API key
3. Set PERPLEXITY_API_KEY in your .env file

servers.name: Image Analysis
servers.description: Multi-modal vision analysis using AI models for image understanding
servers.setup_instructions:
1. Sign up at openrouter.ai
2. Create an API key
3. Set OPENROUTER_API_KEY in your .env file

servers.name: Code Execution
servers.description: Sandboxed code execution environment with resource limits
servers.setup_instructions: No setup required - runs locally with system Python/Node

servers.name: SMS Reader
servers.description: Read SMS and iMessage from macOS Messages app, extract 2FA codes
servers.setup_instructions: Requires Full Disk Access for Python. System Preferences > Privacy & Security > Full Disk Access > add Python.app
